trans-unit.source: Create, edit, and run SQL queries against a DocumentDB collection using Query Explorer | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create, edit, and run SQL queries against a DocumentDB collection using Query Explorer | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the DocumentDB Query Explorer, an Azure Preview portal tool to create, edit, and run SQL queries against a DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the DocumentDB Query Explorer, an Azure Preview portal tool to create, edit, and run SQL queries against a DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: Create, edit, and run SQL queries against a DocumentDB collection using Query Explorer
trans-unit.target: Create, edit, and run SQL queries against a DocumentDB collection using Query Explorer

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of the <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link> Query Explorer, a Microsoft Azure Preview portal tool that enables you to create, edit, and run queries against a DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of the <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link> Query Explorer, a Microsoft Azure Preview portal tool that enables you to create, edit, and run queries against a DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: By completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: By completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: How can I easily create, edit, and run queries against a DocumentDB collection via a web browser?
trans-unit.target: How can I easily create, edit, and run queries against a DocumentDB collection via a web browser?

trans-unit.source: How can I easily navigate through pages of DocumentDB query results via a web browser?
trans-unit.target: How can I easily navigate through pages of DocumentDB query results via a web browser?

trans-unit.source: How can I troubleshoot syntax errors with my DocumentDB query?
trans-unit.target: How can I troubleshoot syntax errors with my DocumentDB query?

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Launch and navigate Query Explorer
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Launch and navigate Query Explorer

trans-unit.source: Query Explorer can be launched from any of the DocumentDB account, database, and collection blades.
trans-unit.target: Query Explorer can be launched from any of the DocumentDB account, database, and collection blades.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the DocumentDB account or database blade, simply click the Query Explorer command.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the DocumentDB account or database blade, simply click the Query Explorer command.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of the Query Explorer command</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of the Query Explorer command</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, near the bottom of each blade is a Developer Tools lens, which contains the Query Explorer tile.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, near the bottom of each blade is a Developer Tools lens, which contains the Query Explorer tile.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer part</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer part</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Simply click the tile to launch Query Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Simply click the tile to launch Query Explorer.

trans-unit.source: The Database and Collection drop-down list boxes are pre-populated depending on the context in which you launch Query Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The Database and Collection drop-down list boxes are pre-populated depending on the context in which you launch Query Explorer.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you launch from a database blade, then the current database is pre-populated.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you launch from a database blade, then the current database is pre-populated.

trans-unit.source: If you launch from a collection blade, then the current collection is pre-populated.
trans-unit.target: If you launch from a collection blade, then the current collection is pre-populated.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create, edit, and run queries with Query Explorer
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create, edit, and run queries with Query Explorer

trans-unit.source: Query Explorer allows you to easily create, edit, and run queries against a DocumentDB collection, and includes basic keyword and value highlighting to improve the query authoring experience.
trans-unit.target: Query Explorer allows you to easily create, edit, and run queries against a DocumentDB collection, and includes basic keyword and value highlighting to improve the query authoring experience.

trans-unit.source: When initially opening Query Explorer, a default query of SELECT * FROM c is provided.
trans-unit.target: When initially opening Query Explorer, a default query of SELECT * FROM c is provided.

trans-unit.source: You can accept the default query or construct your own and then click the Run query button to view the results.
trans-unit.target: You can accept the default query or construct your own and then click the Run query button to view the results.

trans-unit.source: Query Explorer supports the DocumentDB SQL query language as described in <link><linkText>Query DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Query Explorer supports the DocumentDB SQL query language as described in <link><linkText>Query DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer query results</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer query results</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can also enter multiple queries, highlight the one you want to run, and then click the Run query button to view the results.
trans-unit.target: You can also enter multiple queries, highlight the one you want to run, and then click the Run query button to view the results.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer Highlight and Run</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer Highlight and Run</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can load the contents of an existing file using the Load File command.
trans-unit.target: You can load the contents of an existing file using the Load File command.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer Load File</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer Load File</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By default, Query Explorer returns results in sets of 100.
trans-unit.target: By default, Query Explorer returns results in sets of 100.

trans-unit.source: If your query produces more than 100 results, simply use the Next page and Previous page commands to navigate through the result set.
trans-unit.target: If your query produces more than 100 results, simply use the Next page and Previous page commands to navigate through the result set.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer pagination support</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer pagination support</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Successful queries provide information such as the request charge, the set of results currently being shown, and whether there are more results, which can then be accessed via the Next page command, as mentioned previously.
trans-unit.target: Successful queries provide information such as the request charge, the set of results currently being shown, and whether there are more results, which can then be accessed via the Next page command, as mentioned previously.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer query information</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer query information</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Likewise, if a query completes with errors, Query Explorer displays a list of errors that can help with troubleshooting efforts.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, if a query completes with errors, Query Explorer displays a list of errors that can help with troubleshooting efforts.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer query errors</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of Query Explorer query errors</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.target: To learn more about DocumentDB, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the DocumentDB SQL grammar supported in Query Explorer, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the DocumentDB SQL grammar supported in Query Explorer, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: test
